TITLE: Nelson Peltz is launching a blitz on Disney. Here's what he says is next in his proxy fight
SUMMARY: Trian Fund Management will amp up its case to get Nelson Peltz and Jay Rasulo elected to the Disney board in the coming months.

TITLE: Nelson Peltz states his case for joining the Disney board
SUMMARY: The proxy battle comes as CEO Bob Iger tries to streamline the sprawling media company to rein in spending and make its Disney+ streaming platform profitable.

TITLE: Birkenstock shares slump as shoe company warns on profit outlook during first earnings since IPO
SUMMARY: Birkenstock shares dipped nearly 10% Thursday morning after the company shared its first earnings report since its initial public offering.

TITLE: New Morgan Stanley CEO is 'super bullish' on hitting financial targets
SUMMARY: The pivot to wealth management boosted Morgan Stanley's valuation beyond rivals including Goldman Sachs, but more recently growth concerns have stymied shares.

TITLE: NBA postpones second Warriors game after assistant coach’s death
SUMMARY: The Warriors are scheduled to play next on Wednesday against the Atlanta Hawks.

TITLE: Failed JetBlue buyout leaves Spirit Airlines with a tough path forward
SUMMARY: Spirit, whose last profitable year was 2019, had challenges even before the ruling including grounded planes, softening demand and rising costs.

TITLE: China launches a security review of Shein. Here's what it means for its IPO
SUMMARY: China's powerful internet regulator is conducting a security review of Shein as the fast-fashion giant gears up for its highly anticipated U.S. IPO.

TITLE: The weight loss drug market may soon get more crowded. Here are the companies trying to enter the booming space
SUMMARY: Wall Street has been focused on Novo Nordisk, Eli Lilly and other large drugmakers hoping to join the weight loss drug market, such as Pfizer, Roche and Amgen.

TITLE: Jamie Dimon warns 'all these very powerful forces' will impact U.S. economy in 2024 and 2025
SUMMARY: Dimon has remained cautious over the past few years, despite record profits at JPMorgan Chase and a U.S. economy that has defied expectations.

TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment improves for second straight month, following drop in mortgage rates
SUMMARY: Homebuilder sentiment improved in January, jumping 7 points to 44 on the National Association of Home Builders monthly index.

TITLE: Spirit Airlines shares sink 20% in second day of losses after judge blocks JetBlue merger
SUMMARY: It's Spirit's second day of double-digit losses after a judge blocked its proposed merger with JetBlue Airways.

TITLE: Holiday sales climb, boosting retailer hopes that shoppers will spend during uncertain 2024
SUMMARY: Holiday spending was more in line with pre-pandemic levels but reflected the resilience of consumers heading into 2024.

TITLE: Judge blocks JetBlue-Spirit merger after DOJ's antitrust challenge
SUMMARY: JetBlue's proposed $3.8 billion purchase of discounter Spirit would have produced the country's fifth-largest airline.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs tops revenue estimates on better-than-expected asset management results
SUMMARY: Hope is building that Goldman Sachs can turn a corner after pivoting away from CEO David Solomon's failed consumer banking efforts.

TITLE: Burger King owner Restaurant Brands buys chain's largest U.S. franchisee
SUMMARY: Restaurant Brands International will spend about $1 billion to buy Carrols Restaurant Group, the largest U.S. franchisee of Burger King.

TITLE: Pentagon awards $2.5 billion in satellite contracts to L3Harris, Lockheed Martin and Sierra Space
SUMMARY: The Space Force unit on Tuesday announced about $2.5 billion in satellite contracts would go to L3Harris, Lockheed Martin and Sierra Space.

TITLE: Boeing appoints independent advisor to lead 737 Max 9 review as groundings stretch on
SUMMARY: Retired Admiral Kirkland Donald will lead a review of Boeing's quality management system and provide a report to CEO Dave Calhoun.

TITLE: Classic car auction site Bring a Trailer's sales hit record $1.4 billion even as prices drop
SUMMARY: Bring a Trailer's sales climbed in a rare bright spot for the classic-car market.

TITLE: Flight disruptions linger as winter storms, Max 9 grounding snarl travel
SUMMARY: Airlines canceled more than 2,000 U.S. flights Tuesday as winter weather continues to disrupt travel for millions of travelers.

TITLE: Space investment rebounded in 2023 with heavy sector M&A, report says
SUMMARY: Space Capital's report highlighted 2023 as "a year of consolidation," with 39 merger and acquisition deals.

TITLE: 10 years in, GM CEO Mary Barra has built her legacy on change and crisis. 2024 will bring new tests
SUMMARY: GM is facing challenges with EV demand and its Cruise autonomous driving unit, but those headwinds may play to Barra's strengths.

TITLE: 'Mean Girls' is the Queen Bee of the box office, opens to $28 million
SUMMARY: Paramount's "Mean Girls" opened to an estimated $28 million at the domestic box office, on its way to a $32 million take for the holiday weekend.

TITLE: Biotech and pharma companies are betting on a promising class of cancer drugs to drive growth
SUMMARY: The JPMorgan Healthcare Conference was likely just the beginning of another year of heightened interest and investments in ADC cancer drugs.

TITLE: Please stop ignoring your flight attendants
SUMMARY: One lesson to be learned from recent incidents on Japan Airlines and Alaska Airlines: It's time to start paying attention to pre-flight safety demonstrations.

TITLE: The Rubik's Cube turns 50: How a 3-by-3 grid captured hearts and market share
SUMMARY: The cube claims 42% market share in the brain teaser category, and in 2022 brought in $75.3 million in global retail sales.

TITLE: Citigroup is cutting 10% of its workforce in CEO Jane Fraser’s corporate overhaul
SUMMARY: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser announced one of the largest moves to cut headcount at a major U.S. bank in recent years.

TITLE: Airline stocks tumble after Delta trims profit forecast
SUMMARY: Airline stocks including Delta, United, American and Southwest were all down Friday.

TITLE: JPMorgan Chase profit falls after $2.9 billion fee from regional bank rescues
SUMMARY: JPMorgan is watched closely for clues on how banks fared amid volatile interest rates and rising loan losses.

TITLE: Citigroup posts $1.8 billion fourth-quarter loss after litany of charges
SUMMARY: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser announced plans for a sweeping corporate reorganization in September after previous efforts failed to boost the bank's share price.

TITLE: Flight cancellations pile up as winter storm, 737 Max 9 grounding disrupt travel
SUMMARY: Airlines canceled about 2,000 U.S. flights Friday, as they grapple with winter weather and the grounding of the 737 Max 9.
